thread.section_title: The Wall Street Journal & Breaking News, Business, Financial and Economic News, World News and Video
thread.title: The 10-Point.

author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Up and Running
After a three-day shutdown, the U.S. government is open for business once more—albeit after an agreement that did little to resolve the underlying policy fights over immigration and government-spending levels and doesn’t preclude a similar shutdown next month. A three-week spending bill passed Congress and was swiftly signed by President Trump as Senate Democrats accepted Republican leaders’ assurance that they would bring an immigration bill to the floor in the coming weeks. How Democrats shifted...
